elements.name: question7
elements.title: I need help with the following family law issues:

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Protection from family violence
elements.description: Applying for a protection order, to change an existing protection order or to terminate an existing protection made under Part 9 of the Family Law Act.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Family Law Matters including parenting arrangements, child support, contact with a child, guardianship of a child and spousal support under the Family Law Act.
elements.description: Applying for an application for a new order, to change an order, or to cancel an order about a Family Law Matter.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Case management
elements.description: Case management includes administrative or procedural things that need to be done in a court case (usually by a specific time or in a specific way). Sometimes you need to get a case management order from the court to allow you to do something, or to make someone else do something so that you can continue the court case.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Priority parenting matter
elements.description: Priority parenting matters ? are decisions about a child or children that require the agreement of each of the child's guardians or an order from the court and it is priority to get the order before, or separate from, any family law matter order(s). There is a limited list of priority parenting matters. You can ask for other parenting matter orders you may need under family law matters.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Relocation of a child
elements.description: If you have a written agreement or order about parenting arrangements for a child and the other guardian is relocating with a child, you can apply to the court to prohibit the relocation. If you do not have a written agreement or order about parenting arrangements you may need an order about a family law matter or priority parenting matter depending on your circumstances to prevent changes to a child's residence.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Enforcement of agreements and court orders
elements.description: If you have a written agreement or court order that the other party is not following, you can ask the court to help enforce it.

elements.name: page1title
elements.title: This service will help you apply, change or terminate a Provincial Court Family Law Act Protection Order

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Sample Questions for both "I need a Protection Order" and " I want to change an existing Protection Order" and "Safety Check"

elements.name: page2.2title1
elements.title: I need help with the following family law matter:

elements.name: question2.2.1
elements.title: Parenting Arrangements
elements.description: Parenting arrangement are how each guardian will parent their child, including each guardian’s parental responsibilities ? for decision making about a child and the parenting time ? each guardian spends with a child. Parental responsibilities may be shared or exercised separately. The only thing you can consider in making your parenting arrangements is what is in the best interests of the child.

elements.name: question2.2.2
elements.title: Child Support
elements.description: Child support is the amount of money a parent or guardian pays to another parent or guardian to help care for the child. A child has the right to be supported by both parents, whether the parents ever lived together, or the parent has ever lived with the child.

elements.name: question2.2.3
elements.title: Contact With a Child
elements.description: Contact with a child is the time a child spends with someone who is not their guardian. This person could include a parent who is not a guardian to a child, or other people, like grandparents, elders, aunts and uncles, or a family friend.

elements.name: question2.2.4
elements.title: Guardianship of a child
elements.description: Guardianship is who is responsible for a child. Only guardians have parental responsibilities and parenting time with a child. An agreement or order about parenting arrangements can say a child’s guardians share parental responsibilities or parenting time. Or it can say one guardian is responsible for more of the parenting decisions and has more of the parenting time with the child.

elements.name: question2.2.5
elements.title: Spousal Support
elements.description: Spousal support is the money that one spouse pays to another spouse for their financial support after separation. A person is not entitled to spousal support in every case.
